networksim

Class Layer4

  • java.lang.Object
    • networksim.Layer4

  • public class Layer4
extends java.lang.Object
    Layer4.java: This class simulates the functionalities of the Transport Layer (Layer4). It basically receives a file from the host, split it to an specific number of chunks, inserts each chunk into a layer3 frame which in fact is an IP packet. Moreover, some IP packet fields are filled at this layer such as Source IP (Host), Destination IP, Flag and Offset.
    Author:
    Ebad

                   Host host,

      • sendToLayer3

        public static void sendToLayer3(java.io.File fileToSend,
                Host host,
                byte[] destIPAddress)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This functionality is designed for when a node wants to initiate sending a file, receiving it from the host and sending to an specific destination IP address.
        Parameters:
        fileToSend - A handle to the file that should be sent
        host - Host Address
        destIPAddress - Destination IP Address
        chunkSize - The applicable size of a chunk which equals to the MTU subtracted from layer3's header size and layer2's header size.
        tmp - is there to check when the reading process should be considered done, where tmp becomes negative.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public static byte[] intToByteArr(int n)
        This function converts integer to byte array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the byte array is returned

        public static int byteArrToInt13(byte[] arr)

        Returns:
        integer value is returned
